headlands.name: 1st Headland
headlands.description: This is the headland closest to Morgan Bay village. Park on the L just after the concrete weir or follow the track through the first gate.

sectors.name: Bay Watch
sectors.description: Park just after the small bridge. Follow the fisherman path along rocky beach. Bay Watch is the first low crag.

routes.name: Nein
routes.description: 7m R of chimney. Up easy line.

routes.name: Delta Force
routes.description: 4m R of chimney. Up good R trending crack.

routes.name: Windmill Windmill
routes.description: 3m R of chimney. Climb easy blocks.

routes.name: No Hassle
routes.description: 2m R of chimney. Climb up to small ledge and up short L facing corner

routes.name: Eagle Fly Free
routes.description: Start just R of chimney. Move R onto ledge. Very arbitrary route

routes.name: Time Marches
routes.description: Climb the chimney.

routes.name: Silicone Delight
routes.description: Climb crack 3m R of LH end of face.

routes.name: Revolution Now
routes.description: Climb the blocky R trending line that starts L and exits up L facing V-groove at top

routes.name: Bambino
routes.description: Climb the line of short recesses immediately L of arÃªte at LH end of face.

sectors.name: Angels Wall
sectors.description: About 10 meters along the rocky beach in the DM direction, is a wave cut platform. Only to be climbed at low tide on a very calm day.

routes.name: Pixie
routes.description: 4m R of Cupid.

routes.name: Cupid
routes.description: Start at bottom RH corner of small face to R of On the Outside Looking In and climb the obvious L trending, stepped line on excellent rock.

routes.name: On the Outside Looking In
routes.description: Stem op outside of chimney.

routes.name: Gung Ho
routes.description: Climb the pile of suspect blocks R of Water Baby.

routes.name: Water Baby
routes.description: Chimney 3m R of Where Angels Fear to Tread.

routes.name: Where Angels Fear To Tread
routes.description: Up crack in middle of face. Move 1m R into excellent vertical crack line.

routes.name: Even Demons Tremble
routes.description: Start as for Where Angels Fear to Tread. Continue straight up V-shaped recess to top.

routes.name: Roll over Rover
routes.description: 1m L of Where Angels Fear to Tread. Up to sloping block in recess. Step L onto face, then up.

routes.name: Fallen Angel
routes.description: 3m L of Where Angels Fear to Tread. Climb the easy obvious line.
routes.first_ascent: Bugs Spouse, Gavin Peckham & Anthony van Tonder

routes.name: Frigidaire Chimney
routes.description: This route has not been located yet. Original RD reads: Above the shelf just after the Angel Wall shelf. Reached by abseiling from the top of a grungy gully. Climb a straight chimney starting 3m off the deck (this is grade 18). The climb is infested with sand worms, wetness and loose flakes. About 12m long. Only recorded to stop any one from wasting their time doing it again. A heap of shit.

sectors.name: Prometheus
sectors.description: Park just after small bridge. Follow fisherman path along rocky beach. Take the path over Baywatch and Angels Wall. Prometheus is on the land ward side of the path, between Baywatch and Angels Wall.

routes.name: Mercury
routes.description: Climb the very short and easy line on boulder to the MB side of Prometheus, using rails and the arÃªte. Cute!

routes.name: Icarus
routes.description: The line immediately R of Prometheus.

routes.name: Prometheus
routes.description: Start-up slight over hang, straight up face.

routes.name: Pegasus
routes.description: Climb the LH side of 'Y' shaped crack. Follow L trending cracks.

sectors.name: Lust or Love
sectors.description: Continue along the path past Prometheus. Lust or Love is on a grassy ledge just above some rocks forming a cave over a dangerous chimney.

routes.name: Shagadelic
routes.description: 1m L of RH end of crag. Up and L.

routes.name: Please! Please Me!
routes.description: 2m L of Shagadelic. Up and trending R.

routes.name: Keeping Abreast
routes.description: 1m L of Tease Me! Please Me! Climb up to large ledge then up L facing corner.

routes.name: Tease Me, Please Me
routes.description: Start around the blunt arÃªte to L of Keeping Abreast. Move R across a ledge to a L facing open book.

routes.name: One Up One Down
routes.description: Open book, chimney.

routes.name: Liquor is Quicker
routes.description: Start 3m L of One Up One Down. Up the short face on flaky jugs to a large ledge. Then up short bulging face.

routes.name: Lady Star Light
routes.description: Climb the thin line between the open book and arÃªte. Gain the ledge. Climb the last short face close to the arÃªte (to L of the short L facing corner)

routes.name: Candy's Dandy
routes.description: Climb the open book.

routes.name: Give it to Me Baby
routes.description: Start 2m L of Candy's Dandy. Climb the ramp; use the same exit as Candy's Dandy.

routes.name: Self-Control
routes.description: Balance up the thin ramp parallel to and just above the Give It To Me Baby ramp. Top out just left of the Give It To Me Baby exit. Self-control is required to avoid stepping down onto the big Give It To Me Baby ramp.

routes.name: Climax
routes.description: Start-up same off width as Don't Believe Her. Rail R for 4m to reach under clings.

routes.name: Don't Believe Her
routes.description: Climb the off width on the far L. Traverse L near the top.

sectors.name: California Dreaming
sectors.description: Take the first gate to the left traveling from Morgan Bay to Double Mouth. The track to the left leads to parking on top of the First Headland. Find the steep passage (easy chimney). The walk-in chimney looks worse than it is.

routes.name: Apple Crumble
routes.description: Loose, blocky line to the right of So Few are so Free. Avoid!

routes.name: So Few are so Free
routes.description: Perfect crack in centre of seaward face.

routes.name: Stolen Thunder
routes.description: Climb the middle of the steeper slab immediately R of descent path.

routes.name: Nowhere Man
routes.description: Start-up rotten crack/ledges in the centre of the recess that separates the two smooth faces. Up for 8m till it begins to overhang. Step across to the RH crack. Finish up the RH crack.

routes.name: Penny Lane
routes.description: Start in big recess and climb the crack L of Nowhere Man. Use the R wall and then the L half way up. Break L and finish on a series of ledges.

routes.name: California Dreaming
routes.description: Climb the double crack system on the LH side of the second face. The LH crack curves to the R for about 4m before becoming a V-shaped groove. Start-up RH crack. 5m up move into LH crack and up the V-shaped groove.

routes.name: Sleeping with the Dog
routes.description: Climb the prominent fist crack at LH edge of LH wall.

routes.name: Systematic Selection
routes.description: 3m R of Storm Trooper of the Dark Ride, up an off width through a small roof. Continue up beyond this to a belay where the grass starts.

routes.name: Before The Seventh War
routes.description: Open book 1m L of Storm Trooper of the Dark Ride. Through the roof & up the crack on the sea face.

routes.name: PraHAA
routes.description: L trending diagonal crack. Loose and shit.

routes.name: Surfer Girl
routes.description: Crack just L of L trending diagonal crack.

routes.name: Seal Wolf
routes.description: Up easy crack.

routes.name: Beach Bums
routes.description: Easy slab steps.

routes.name: Beach Boys
routes.description: Easy slab steps around the corner.

routes.name: Surfing USA
routes.description: Crack system with large 'V' ledge just L of chimney on the DM side of large ledge.

routes.name: No Smoke No Fire
routes.description: Chimney on DM side of large ledge.

routes.name: This Too Shall Pass
routes.description: Crack system up blocky steps.

sectors.name: Promised Land
sectors.description: The first band of rock is about 30m below the car park on the First Headland. The routes are short (about 10m on average), but the rock quality is stunning and is rarely affected by tides. Work your way down using a series of breaks in the rock bands.

routes.name: Hey There
routes.description: Slab sea ward face of small buttress 8m on the DM side of prominent V-crack with roof, The Glory.

routes.name: Thou Shalt Not
routes.description: Short easy crack.

routes.name: The Glory
routes.description: Climb the large V-crack past the roof.

routes.name: Shoulder to Cry On
routes.description: Off width into chimney.

routes.name: Manna
routes.description: Up blocky face and through roof.

routes.name: Wake Up
routes.description: This is a perfect easy crack.

routes.name: Mossad
routes.description: LH off-width.

routes.name: Moses
routes.description: Climb the funny crack system that at first is hidden. Start in the L side. Move a bit R about 9m up.

routes.name: Mother of Moses
routes.description: Up the flaring V-shaped chimney.

routes.name: Heroes Don't Cry
routes.description: Up the obvious crack system.

routes.name: Hail of Rocks
routes.description: Hand crack into off width.

routes.name: Escape or Die
routes.description: Climb the thin crack up steps.

routes.name: Hail of Metal
routes.description: Open book chimney.

routes.name: Broken Promises
routes.description: Broken stepped, blocky ramp.

routes.name: The Point of No Return
routes.description: Up stepped easy face.

routes.name: My Father's House
routes.description: Flaky start to L of pool. Curving crack into large off width with no gear.

routes.name: Project
routes.description: R trending crack to the R. Just too wet to start with.

routes.name: Parting of the Seas
routes.description: Abseil down green seaweed face to wave cut platform. Climb the big chimney on the MB side of the ledge, till you reach the high point. Only in extremely low tide with a strong berg wind.

routes.name: Secret Promise
routes.description: Climb the short easy line on the LH side of the slab, starting at the top of the high ground.

routes.name: Deuteronomy
routes.description: Start in the chimney below the slab. Then up on the RH side of the easy slab.

routes.name: The Exodus
routes.description: The line to the R of Deuteronomy.

routes.name: The Commandment
routes.description: Start in an open book. Becomes loose, slimy and scary higher up.

routes.name: Duke of York
routes.description: Climb the L facing corner to a ledge at the base of a chimney. Up the short face on the R using round holds, to gain a ledge. Up another short face to a belay ledge.

routes.name: Yom Kippur
routes.description: Start just R of Duke of York. Climb up to reach the start of a V-shaped recess formed by a long flake. Up this to a short open book to a ledge. Up another short face to a belay ledge.

routes.name: Any Way But Down
routes.description: Start just R of Yom Kippur. Up two finger cracks to a sloping ledge and a short corner crack. Will have to pull on gear if wet. Gain a ledge. Up another short face to a belay ledge.

routes.name: Mission Motherland
routes.description: Start a few meters R of Hisbal'as. Up an on balance open book to below a roof. Move L below roof. Easiest line to gain a ledge. Up another short face to a belay ledge.

routes.name: Winter Heart's Guild
routes.description: Slightly to the MB side of Mission Motherland. Up an easy start to the R of the slab arÃªte. Break L onto the arÃªte. Up into a small open book. Top out trending L.

routes.name: Tempting Moses
routes.description: Up an easy R facing open book 1m R of Winter Heart's Guild. Onto a large ledge. Up a loose off width open book behind the face. The route ends in the California Dreaming.

routes.name: Green Death
routes.description: 4m R of Winter Heart's Guild, up tricky slippery ramp to the big ledge. Across the ledge to the low point in the ledge path of California Dreaming. Walk out using the steep scramble chimney or abseil from the point below Storm Trooper of the Dark Ride. See California Dreaming.

sectors.name: M15
sectors.description: This small but pleasant crag can be found above Cassinga Wall, but further out towards the sea. Park on the First Headland. Look for a steep walk down. Face is better seen from the Second Headland. Routes are listed land ward to sea ward.

routes.name: Spear Head
routes.description: From the walk-in, Traverse under the crag to a diagonal crack on the LH side. Up this.

routes.name: Special Branch
routes.description: LH perfect crack.

routes.name: CI Arse
routes.description: Perfect crack L of open book.

routes.name: Top Secret
routes.description: Open book.

sectors.name: Cassinga
sectors.description: Cassinga is the wall, which starts at sea level, on the MB side of the gully which separates the First and Second Headlands. Park either of the two headlands. Walk down the grassy gully to the rocky beach.

routes.name: The Endless Steppes
routes.description: Very short easy line about 5m L of Agent Orange.

routes.name: Savannah
routes.description: Another short easy line. 2m L of Agent Orange.

routes.name: Fear and Flight
routes.description: Start 2m L of Cassinga. Crack starting L and running across Agent Orange, forming an 'X'.

routes.name: Agent Orange
routes.description: Start 1m L of Cassinga. This is the crack which starts on the R and runs diagonally L.

routes.name: Cassinga
routes.description: This is the prominent line that follows the overhanging, stepped, open book.

routes.name: Golden Eye
routes.description: Diagonal RH crack. Easy but, quite nice.

routes.name: Crazy Mary
routes.description: Triangular cracks. Traverse R to slab. Top out.

routes.name: Stalingrad
routes.description: On balance open book. 15m

routes.name: Spetznat
routes.description: Crack into stepped chimney. 25m

routes.name: Siberia
routes.description: Crack just R of Siberia. Traverse to gain thin cracks L of slab. 25m

routes.name: Buffalo Bastards
routes.description: Climb the line just L of the prominent chimney.

routes.name: We Didn't Start the Fire
routes.description: Up the prominent chimney.

routes.name: Evolution Crack
routes.description: This is the crack on the land ward side of the stack. It is wet and can only be done on an extreme low and during a berg wind. If you must...take extra chalk.

routes.name: Stack Attack
routes.description: Step onto the side of the stack from the DM side. A better option than Evolution Crack.

headlands.name: 2nd Headland
headlands.description: Traveling from Morgan Bay turn left through the first gate. Follow the track along the fence. Park at the end of the fence. This is the Second Headland.

sectors.name: Afghanistan
sectors.description: This area can be reached by parking above the gully between the First and Second Headlands. Walk down the gully. The routes are to be found on mess of rock on the DM side of the gully.

routes.name: From Russia with Love
routes.description: This is the first conceivable route on the DM side as you walk down the grassy gully. It's very stepped and broken.

routes.name: Rasputin
routes.description: Climb the big, broken and loose open book.

routes.name: Loose Rock 101
routes.description: Up broken steps into crack, R of roof. Matt threw more crap off this route than the entire US forces dropped in Afghanistan in the same year. Fucking Americans!

routes.name: Black Adder
routes.description: This route starts a few meters L of the scramble to the upper sector. Climb the off-width L trending crack till it merges with The Kremlin. Up easy slabs to the top.

routes.name: The Kremlin
routes.description: Start about 5m L of Black Adder climb the vertical crack till you are under the block. Step R and climb the easy slabs to the top.

routes.name: Russian Roulette
routes.description: Climb the easy stepped off width about 5m L of The Kremlin.

routes.name: MIG-17
routes.description: About 5m L of Russian Roulette. Climb the RH crack in the L facing corner.

routes.name: Nikita
routes.description: Climb the LH crack of the L facing corner.

routes.name: Rag Head
routes.description: Start close to where the wave cut platform begins. Up easy stepped line to ledge walk off to the R.

routes.name: Goose Step
routes.description: Starting at the water line Traverse L to a good easy crack. Up stepped line. Moving L near the top.

routes.name: Blood Flower
routes.description: Up just L of blunt curved arete, step L over ledges, across a gully, then up onto ramp & up a small headwall. Step L across a ledge & up R trending small open book.

routes.name: Rolling Stones
routes.description: Easy loose crack.

routes.name: Rambo-who?
routes.description: Chossy loose chimney.

routes.name: Buckets Full of Bastards
routes.description: Start in crack to R of chimney. Onto ledge. Up face onto bouldery ledge. Hard move to top out. Last move is about 19.

routes.name: The Mongrel
routes.description: Start in wide crack that splits into twin cracks, onto ledge, stepping L past ramp off width to a short face. Climb the short face.

routes.name: Panty-less
routes.description: Chimney to R of abseil point.

routes.name: A Scenery of Loss
routes.description: Up cracks to ledge below the arÃªte. Up LHS of arÃªte.

routes.name: The Afghans
routes.description: Up short face L of commercial abseil point. Onto ramp, then move L into off width chimney. Through blocky roof to abseil point.

routes.name: ARC Rising
routes.description: Up short arÃªte, step R & up face. Stay R of LH arÃªte.

routes.name: Anarchy at the Crags
routes.description: Up easy steps to gain RH crack over large ledge. Up crack system above.

routes.name: Hell in a Bucket
routes.description: If you are into dirt, loose rock and grass....this is for you. Total crap!

routes.name: Breakfast with the Taliban
routes.description: Diagonal crack past small roof. Just to the R of the small cave.

routes.name: Illusion and Fear
routes.description: Find the small face. Climb the wide open book recess. Up this to the top. Thin gear!

routes.name: The Cry Of Silence
routes.description: Up below treacherous looking huge flakes on great jugs. Up blank face above.

routes.name: Sleuth
routes.description: Chimney.

routes.name: Shaken Not Stirred
routes.description: Up nice looking crack that trends diagonally L half way up.

routes.name: Re-animator
routes.description: Up cracked ramp.

routes.name: Money Penny
routes.description: Up the arÃªte. Move L near the top. Belay off high point to L.

routes.name: Rocky Track
routes.description: Very easy blocky route.

routes.name: Jungle Bunny
routes.description: Start in off width to the R. Step L onto ramp. Up middle of the ramp.

routes.name: Iron Will
routes.description: Start up finger crack, onto ledge. Step L on ledge to LH arÃªte. Up arÃªte edge.
routes.first_ascent: Derek Marshall & Dirk van der Walt

routes.name: Rope Grab
routes.description: Up easy L facing open book.

sectors.name: Kindergarten
sectors.description: This small crag is a few meters below the car park on the 2nd Headland. All the routes are high-ball or boulder routes. Routes are listed L to R. We all know Gavin sand bagged these routes so add a grade or 2 to get the true grade.

routes.name: Miss Muffet
routes.description: Up the wide R trending crack.

routes.name: Rock On Top
routes.description: Up the chimney capped by a large chock.

routes.name: Wydsbeen
routes.description: Up the flaring chimney to the R of Rock On Top.

routes.name: Jack Horner's ... Corner
routes.description: Up the sloping corner.

routes.name: Rocking Horse
routes.description: Up the crack.

routes.name: Simple Simon
routes.description: Climb the crack with the wedged boulders.

routes.name: Humpty Dumpty
routes.description: Climb the Lay back.

routes.name: Bo Peep
routes.description: This is the L tending, blocky line about 2m R of Humpty Dumpty and just L of the small arÃªte at the RH end of the crag.

sectors.name: Memorial Slab
sectors.description: Situated directly below two memorial stones at the end of the track. This awesome slab may need new bolts to be led safely.

routes.name: Uit Die Blou van Ons Se Hemel
routes.description: These bolts are old & dangerous.

routes.name: Marching On
routes.description: Prominent crack in middle of face, past a single bolt in to unprotect able face above.

routes.name: Our Victory
routes.description: Start in Marching On prominent crack. 4m up step L onto rounded ramp, traverse L, up below small overhang & L into L facing open book. Don't clip any bolts.
routes.first_ascent: Derek Marshall & Dirk van der Walt

routes.name: Uit Diepte van Ons See
routes.description: These bolts are old & dangerous.

routes.name: Waar Die Kraanz Sal Andword Gee
routes.description: These bolts are old & dangerous. Direct start without bridging is 22-ish.

routes.name: Captain Morgan
routes.description: Start in wide chimney. Move onto land ward ramp and top out.

routes.name: Enjoy the Silence
routes.description: Start in middle of featured face, move R onto arÃªte & up the arÃªte. Break out R of the arÃªte below the boulder on top. Over easy ground to the top.

routes.name: Trip The Darkness
routes.description: Up RH crack, break out R onto the face at overhang. Up using the LH arÃªte, then over easy ground to the top.

routes.name: Masekane Man
routes.description: Up LH crack, onto ledge & over easy ground to the top.

routes.name: Swamped
routes.description: Up blunt arÃªte, on ledge step L onto blocky ridge.

routes.name: Stone Crusher
routes.description: Up L trending blocky crack.

routes.name: Eat my Vag
routes.description: Short L trending blocky break.

routes.name: Shagadelic Nicole
routes.description: Up blocky ramp on rails.

routes.name: Puffadder Crack
routes.description: R facing blocky open book. The puff adder who lives on the top of the crag had fun scaring the crap out of Noodles.

routes.name: Marriage Monster
routes.description: Up rounded cheeks, then directly up middle of face.
routes.first_ascent: Terence Trevaskis, Derek Marshall & Dirk van der Walt

routes.name: Seeking the Serpent
routes.description: Up steps into nice fist crack. Over ledge directly, up prominent crack.

routes.name: Slithering Up
routes.description: Up L facing small open book into prominent hand crack.

routes.name: Slut Crack
routes.description: Short off with & chimney crack.

sectors.name: Land's End
sectors.description: This rather short crag hosts a number of fine easy routes. Ideal for beginners learning to lead trad. Park at the end of the track on the 2nd Headland. Walk down the ridge, turning R before walking off the edge. The path L leads seaward to Lands End.

routes.name: Paying Dues
routes.description: Up the short obvious break on LH side

routes.name: Under the Blade
routes.description: Up the thinly protected slab, into R trending diagonal crack & through the break in the small roof.

routes.name: African Star
routes.description: Climb the crack L of the recess, which has the large dangerous block.

routes.name: Keep the Faith
routes.description: Up the thinly protected slab. Gear is marginal.

routes.name: Treason
routes.description: Up the L side of large recess. The block is dangerous! Through the roof to the L.

routes.name: So Long Mary Ann
routes.description: Up the R side of large recess. The block is dangerous!

routes.name: Fear of God
routes.description: Up the thinly protected slab. Gear is marginal.

routes.name: My Eye On You
routes.description: Climb the obvious large crack.

routes.name: Not All There
routes.description: Start between My I On U & Wind Blast. Climb the obvious but thin line that tends slightly R.

routes.name: Land's End Traverse
routes.description: Start-up Wind Blast. About halfway up, start traversing out to the L following the easiest (or the most interesting) line until you run out of rock on the LHS of the crag. About 25 m long.

routes.name: Wind Blast
routes.description: Start on the R. Up the L trending diagonal crack.

routes.name: Windgap
routes.description: Climb the easy recess on the R.

routes.name: Blown Away
routes.description: Up the slab arÃªte.

sectors.name: The Platform
sectors.description: From Lands End, walk seaward to a very steep grassy gully which runs down the DM side of the headland to the wave cut platform. This is the broken face on the land ward side of the steep walk in. Routes are listed from DM to MB.

routes.name: Selfish Prick
routes.description: Climb the extremely short line 5m L of Ugly.

routes.name: Quattro Drive
routes.description: Climb the nice-looking easy ramp line 2m L of Ugly.

routes.name: Black Avo... Yum!
routes.description: Climb the awful loose ramps to gain the awful loose off width.

routes.name: Ugly
routes.description: Climb the gully On the DM side of Godzilla Wall.

routes.name: Still Is Was
routes.description: Climb the most L easy recess on the sea ward face. Onto large ledge.

routes.name: Green Goblin
routes.description: Climb the easy recess 4,5m L of Godzilla. Gain the ledge. Over the ledge climb the loose off width to a belay point.

routes.name: Jurassic Fart
routes.description: Start 4m L of Godzilla. Move to the L to gain the ledge. Over the ledge climb the loose off width to a belay point.

routes.name: Father of Woe
routes.description: Climb the crack directly below the pock marked face. Through the pocked face.

routes.name: Apprentizorious
routes.description: Start just L of Godzilla. Up series of steps to the L. Gain the large ledge. Climb the L side to reach the top of the face.

routes.name: Godzilla
routes.description: Climb the LH off width. Up the Chimney.

routes.name: Donnersaurus
routes.description: Climb the RH off width. Up the chimney.

routes.name: Feels so Good
routes.description: Start in the gully near the center of the wrinkly face, directly below the main, vertical crack line that splits the upper half of the face. Follow this vertical crack to the top.

routes.name: Avo Ants
routes.description: Climb the open book. Move R at the small roof. Up short open book to the top.

routes.name: Godzilla Dung
routes.description: Climb the easy stepped diagonal just L of Avo Ants.

routes.name: Marriage Potential
routes.description: The first tiny route. Climb the off width, into lay back. Look out for two loose blocks. Sweet!

routes.name: Potential Vasectomy
routes.description: Climb the short easy crack 1m L of notched arÃªte.

routes.name: Skriek Vir Niks
routes.description: Climb the satanic chimney. Easily protected with one No. 6 & two No.5 Friends, as well as two No. 4 Big Bros.

routes.name: Once in a Lifetime
routes.description: Start 2,5m R of Skriek Vir Niks, in a recess below a roof which undercuts the RH arÃªte. Exit roof to the R. Keep just R of arÃªte to the top. Good gear all the way.

routes.name: Tracking Matt
routes.description: Start 5m R of Once in a Lifetime arÃªte. Climb the L most, loose crack. Easily protected with one No. 6 Friend and both 4 & 5 Big Bros.

routes.name: Howzat
routes.description: 5m L of diamond shaped block. Climb the RH open book of rectangular recess onto grassy ledge.

routes.name: The Rise and the Fall
routes.description: 1m R of Howzat. Climb the on either side of thin vertical finger crack.

routes.name: Behind Enemy Lines
routes.description: Start 3m L of diamond shaped block. Layback up to the crack that runs up the back of an undercut, L-facing corner and continue up to the ledge.

routes.name: Twilight of the Gods
routes.description: Start 2m L of diamond shaped block. Layback up into crack and follow it to ledge.

routes.name: Follow the Sign
routes.description: Climb on to the diamond shaped block. Climb short crack on the L. Rail R onto knobbled face. Up... top out. Doggy gear!

routes.name: The Gods Must Be Crazy
routes.description: Loose chimney.

routes.name: Apprentices Need To Cry
routes.description: Climb the easy stepped off width 5m R of diamond shaped block. Ever so slightly crap.

routes.name: White Breasts of Cormorants
routes.description: Climb the crack line 4m R of choosy open book. Stay in the narrow crack all the way to the top.

routes.name: Bird Shit King
routes.description: About 12m from White Breasts of Cormorants, towards MB. Climb the twin cracks (less than 1m apart). The LH is an off width and the R notched. Up these to cool hand crack. Traverse R onto knobby face. Belay with the birds. If bird shit is your thing this one is for you.

sectors.name: Catfish Cove
sectors.description: Walk down to boulder beach between Second and Third Headlands. The following routes are on the MB side of the cove and are listed from L to R.

routes.name: Black Angel at Your Side
routes.description: Climb the short-zigzagged crack, on the small face on the MB side of the walk down. Start 1m L of perfect hand crack.

routes.name: Dirty Harry
routes.description: Climb the short, perfect, and straight hand crack on the small face on the MB side of the walk down.

routes.name: Octopus Up
routes.description: Climb the chimney groove 1.5m R of Dirty Harry.

routes.name: Tear of God
routes.description: Climb the rampy off width open book 4m R of Dirty Harry.

routes.name: Lithic Mulch Extreme
routes.description: Up LH crack crossing R till the grass. Keep on up to belay off the fence post. Not fun.

routes.name: Nurse! Nurse! I'm Feeling Worse
routes.description: Climb the loose crack in the slab, which starts on the R and crosses another crack to form a rough "X". Onto grass. Up scary grass till belay is found. A 60m rope will take you to the fence posts.

routes.name: War...She's a Whore!
routes.description: Climb the prominent loose crack 2m R of the start of Nurse! Nurse! I'm Feeling Worse. Use the finger crack and the plusher crack 1m to the R. Head to the fence if you have a 60m rope. Belay off a well chosen post.

routes.name: Dark Angel
routes.description: Up the easy stepped crack which starts on the steep grass slope. Move L onto veg ledge. Pass block to L. Up veggie scramble to awesome off width.

routes.name: King Contrary Man
routes.description: Climb the groove 2m R of Dark Angel. Gain the veg ledge. Move to the L and around block. Traverse up and R. Climb the crack behind the large block. Up grass. Hunt for a belay...not easy.

routes.name: Pogrom Day
routes.description: Climb the prominent, flaring, off width 1m L of Beer Fish. Belay below sharp arÃªte. Escape safely by staying roped for a second easy pitch.

routes.name: Beer Fish
routes.description: Near the water line there are two obvious, parallel L trending chimney grooves. Climb the better looking LH groove.
routes.first_ascent: Ian Schwarts, Mike Louw & Wendy Jenkin

routes.name: Bobfish
routes.description: Climb the RH of the above-mentioned grooves.
routes.first_ascent: Ian Schwarts, Mike Louw & Wendy Jenkin

routes.name: Cat Fish Rising
routes.description: P1 - 20 Start at the low tide mark and climb a thin finger crack to a ledge. P2- 15 Continue up the easy but pleasant wall above.

routes.name: Barfly Retching
routes.description: Climb the thin L leaning crack line about 10 or 15m inland of the water line. Unfortunately the water line moves up and down with the tide. So this could be about any thin crack on the face.

routes.name: A Sailor to Die
routes.description: Climb the short off width to top of block.

routes.name: Little Angel
routes.description: 2m R of off width, climb the thin line for 5m to a ledge. Move slightly L and up. Not very long. Scramble off block on the MB side. Route does not continue up rippled face.

routes.name: Competing With the Wind
routes.description: Climb the easy L trending diagonal to the top of the block. Scramble off block on the MB side.

routes.name: Merchants of Death
routes.description: Up easy steps onto big ledge. Up open book into loose crack. Take the easiest line L to a belay point.

routes.name: Peace Dog
routes.description: 2m R of Merchants of Death. Up nice crack onto ledge. Move R onto up turned "V" rocks and into easy "V" shaped crack. At the top of this, continue up crap grass for about 25m to safe belay.

sectors.name: Castaways
sectors.description: This area is easiest reached by, parking on the 2nd Headland and walking down the grassy gully between the 2nd and 3rd Headlands. Castaways is situated near the top, on the DM side of the grassy gully. Unfortunately the lines are more than a tad on the short side. Routes are recorded MB to DM.

routes.name: Faith Healer
routes.description: Scramble up the easy ramp on the sea ward face. Climb the diagonal R crack to top out.

routes.name: Dinosaur Worm
routes.description: Climb the very short off width. Move L to hole through rock. Up nose to top.

routes.name: Hunters
routes.description: Climb the "V" shaped crack with the square block in it.

routes.name: Captaino Insano
routes.description: Quite nice climbing. About 8m R of Naked Island. Climb the short obvious crack for 8m. Belay from ledge.

routes.name: Skirmish
routes.description: Start on the big ledge where Captaino Insano ends. Climb the obvious crack for 7m. Short but not so sweet.

routes.name: Spirit Walker
routes.description: This is the very thin line 1.5m to the R of Naked Island. There is no clear crack. From the big ledge up the off width to the L of the over hang.

routes.name: Naked Island
routes.description: Thin start, to inverted 'V' crack. Awesome line.

routes.name: Feeling Fragile
routes.description: Prominent line, with thin start.

routes.name: Sheltering Desert
routes.description: Thinly protected slab.

routes.name: Ring Piece Raider
routes.description: Climb this easy line. It has one removable bolt hole about 5m off the deck, but it is easy to climb the route without placing the removable bolt. Very short.

routes.name: Stranded
routes.description: Short easy line to the L

sectors.name: Storm Bringer
sectors.description: This is a small stack of rock. The routes are too short to be magic routes. Basically all these routes would be bouldered if it were not for rolling off the cliffs & into the sea. Fun...none the less!

routes.name: Smoke on the Water
routes.description: Fat crack to the L.

routes.name: Fire in the Sky
routes.description: Centre finger crack to small roof.

routes.name: Thunder Below
routes.description: Open book into roof.

routes.name: Storm Bringer
routes.description: Up the short arete layaway, traverse R & into crack.

routes.name: You Can't stop Rock 'n Roll
routes.description: Up prominent wide crack in edge.

routes.name: Fake Snoek
routes.description: Up the prominent finger crack, through small roof & top out.

routes.name: BS Gear & Sheer Determination
routes.description: Up the open book, through small roof & top out.

routes.name: Soldier Under Comand
routes.description: Start L of blunt arete prow, up on rails & ledges, move R around the arÃªte & up the RHS.
routes.first_ascent: Derek Marshall, Craig Bester & Patrick Brown

sectors.name: Bionic Man
sectors.description: This small sector is located above the deep gorge between the 3rd & 4thHeadlands. Sector is easily identified by the small stack set away from a smooth pitted face just below the vehicle track level.

routes.name: Bionic Man
routes.description: Climb the only crack in the pocked face on the DM side of the small stack.

routes.name: Project
routes.description: Up on pockets & dimples.

routes.name: Revival of the Fittest
routes.description: Up on pockets & dimples 1.5 m R of the blunt arÃªte.

routes.name: More Than Enough
routes.description: Up the blunt arÃªte.

routes.name: Steve
routes.description: Climb the RH arÃªte of the MB face of the small stack.

routes.name: Man van Staal
routes.description: Climb the short L facing open book on the MB face of the small stack.

routes.name: Done Dirt Cheap
routes.description: Up the "clean" spat of rock. Start on a bit of a ramp & then up a bit of an arÃªte. There is a cool hollowed out "handle" on the LHS of the block on top.

headlands.name: 4th Headland
headlands.description: Traveling from MB towards DM, turn left through the 2nd gate. Follow the track, which curves L. Park where the track forms a car park.

sectors.name: Rock Rabbit Wall
sectors.description: Descend the grassy slope on the MB side of the headland. About 15m down begin to traverse landward. Rock Rabbit Wall is the shortish not-so-good-looking splash of rock to the L.

routes.name: Roger Rabbit
routes.description: Climb the short open book.
routes.first_ascent: Anthony & Rodger van Tonder, Gavin Peckham

routes.name: What's Up Doc
routes.description: Climb the chimney, then through the roof.

routes.name: Bleeding Heart Graffiti
routes.description: Start on the arÃªte that forms the RH side of the chimney. Keep to the R of the arÃªte.

routes.name: Remember When
routes.description: Up L facing open books, onto big ledge. Step a bit R then up prominent crack.

routes.name: Brae Rabbit
routes.description: Climb the loose looking face to the R of Remember When. Some of the pro is dubious.

routes.name: New Wine
routes.description: Up crack just L of arÃªte, onto ledge. Up to R of off-width, but using off-width.

routes.name: Bugs Bunny
routes.description: Climb the chimney to the R of Brae Rabbit.

routes.name: Elmer J Fudd
routes.description: Up the short slab.

routes.name: Nibbles
routes.description: Chimney.

routes.name: Rogerer
routes.description: Climb the easy slab.

routes.name: Wabbit Twacks
routes.description: Up the short easy chimney.

routes.name: Milk & Honey
routes.description: Up crack & horizontal cracks. Up ramp recess. Would go free at ~25.

sectors.name: Ticket to Ride
sectors.description: Park on the 4th Headland. Descend on the MB village side of the headland. This area has a great tea spot & a number of stunning lines. This is a good spot to take beginners or for a first visit with limited time.

routes.name: Pick Pocket
routes.description: Climb the short off width on the LH side.

routes.name: Sugar or Honey
routes.description: Up to R of arÃªte using rails & the arÃªte, but not the off-width. Where the off-width runs out, step L to a belay spot.

routes.name: Paper Back Writer
routes.description: Up the L tending ramp, then up the prominent crack. Just below the top the crack makes a dog's-leg to R for 1 m (crux) before continuing to the top.

routes.name: This Makes Sense
routes.description: Start in recess. Up rails on face between Paper Back Writer & Day Tripper, into thin crack. Avoid going into either Paper Back Writer & Day Tripper.

routes.name: Day Tripper
routes.description: Start in the recess to the L of the block. Up the obvious crack line.

routes.name: Come to Me
routes.description: Up the crack with two 'V' roves. Directly up between Day Tripper & Genesis, without using either.

routes.name: Genesis
routes.description: Start on the LH side of the block. Up the ramp to gain a vertical crack.

routes.name: Ticket to Ride
routes.description: Climb the very prominent crack which starts in the middle of the block.

routes.name: Trade the Darkness
routes.description: Up, tacking on the rails between Ticket to Ride & The Feeling is Tight. This route does out of necessity use the arÃªtes of Ticket to Ride & The Feeling is Tight.

routes.name: The Feeling is Tight
routes.description: Start to R of block. Climb the ever widening off width crack.

routes.name: Purple Rain
routes.description: Climb the arÃªte between the Ticket to Ride & Natal Faces. Keep to the L of the arÃªte for the first half, and then step to the R. Keeping close to the arÃªte to the top. There is good protection to be had.
routes.first_ascent: Clee Roy, Andrew Forsyth, Pixie Fuller & Alan Briers

routes.name: Footsie
routes.description: Start just L of Catch 22. Climb the over hang on the R. Using holds on Catch 22 is off route.

routes.name: Catch 22
routes.description: Climb the crack through the roof, 1m R of the arÃªte.

routes.name: Thin Ice
routes.description: Climb the slab with a crack through it to gain the vertical crack, about 1.5 m R of Catch 22.

routes.name: Natal
routes.description: Climb the prominent crack 3.5m R of Catch 22. There were top anchors placed, but they were removed soon afterwards.

routes.name: Roofy and Goofy
routes.description: Start just L of Acne. Traverse L below the roof for about 3m along good under clings. Through the roof and up diagonally L to the top of Natal.
routes.first_ascent: Steve Davis & R. van der Wiel

routes.name: Acne
routes.description: Climb the broken line 5m R of Catch 22. It is better than it looks.

routes.name: Ob-La-Di, Ob-La-Da
routes.description: Abseil onto sloping square ledge. Start-up good short crack on the L. Climb to start of large grassy chimney. Up the blocks on the L. Then up stepped face to the top.

routes.name: Please Please Me
routes.description: Abseil on to same ledge as above. Climb the off width open book on the L. Climb this to gain the chimney. Over huge chock stone to the top.

routes.name: Lost Digit
routes.description: Belaying from the same ledge as above. Traverse R to find the next prominent crack. Climb to large block. Move L round a corner and up a ramp.
routes.first_ascent: Gary Hodgekinson & Carl van der Linger

routes.name: Hey Jude
routes.description: Using same belay as above. Traverse about 1m further R than Lost Digit. Climb the broken, blocky crack system through a minor roof.

routes.name: Yellow Submarine
routes.description: Start to R and below the above ledge. Up an open book to gain a crack in a groove. Through an easy roof to the top.

routes.name: Babes in Black
routes.description: Climb the short off width on the face closest to the rest of Natal Face. Through the awkward cubby hole onto a big ledge. Up the big open book.

routes.name: Skeletor
routes.description: Climb the easy open book to large ledge. Up the same big open book.

routes.name: Lucy in the Sky
routes.description: Climb the obvious curving crack on the RH wall of the descent gully.

routes.name: Lowest Mangy Cur
routes.description: Very short, very easy slab to the R of the blocky off width open book.

routes.name: Twisting With Trad
routes.description: Blocky off width open book using LH exit crack at the top.

routes.name: Tower of Glory
routes.description: Start to the L of blocky off width open book. Move R then Traverse L onto the arÃªte & to the top.

routes.name: Radio Free Moscow
routes.description: On the MB side of pillar. Start on the seaward corner. Move R onto the RH arÃªte. Climb through some awkward overhanging bits to the top. There are chains on top, but they would be rusted through by now.

routes.name: Our Lady of the Abattoir
routes.description: On the sea ward face. Climb the nasty looking off width on the R. Trend L into central chimney crack.

routes.name: Stone Hinge Fakes
routes.description: Climb the thin crack to the L. Top out using the same chimney as above.

routes.name: Lovingly Fondled
routes.description: Up prominent blocky crack break. Where this thins out near the top, step R onto the arÃªte.

sectors.name: Blue Jay Buttress
sectors.description: Blue Jay Buttress is the small buttress which overlooks the Ticked to Ride. Fairly dense wild banana trees hide the base and part of the routes. Do not be put off by them Blue Jay Buttress doesn't look like much, but it is actually quite good climbing.

routes.name: Kortbroek
routes.description: Climb the middle of the short, clean face to the R of Blackbird.
routes.first_ascent: Rodney Owen, Eric Penman, Gavin Peckham & Anthony van Tonder

routes.name: Blackbird
routes.description: Start up the narrow face just to the R of the Blue Jay open book. Into sharp edged chimney on top.
routes.first_ascent: Rodney Owen, Eric Penman, Gavin Peckham & Anthony van Tonder

routes.name: Blue Jay
routes.description: Climb the large off width, stepped open book. Gear is better than it looks.
routes.first_ascent: C.Boswell-Brown, Pete Hawkes, Carol Fenn, Fred Vogelsang & Benji Thorpe

routes.name: John Brown
routes.description: Start in the short wide crack. Then up the stepped arÃªte.

routes.name: G String
routes.description: Climb the thin multi crack system.

routes.name: 5 o'clock Shark
routes.description: Climb the large crack with wedged block in the sloping face.
routes.first_ascent: Gary Hodgkinson, Carl van der Lingen & Dave Freer

routes.name: Bubblegum Pain
routes.description: Up the crack system behind the banana trees.
routes.first_ascent: Dirk van der Walt & Craig Bester

routes.name: Schnaffeled from the Fornicator
routes.description: Open book crack, then 0.5m R near the top.

routes.name: Life and Life to the Full
routes.description: Safety note: These bolts are past their expiry. Beware!

routes.name: Reaper at Your Side
routes.description: Start in overhanging "V" grovel. From the top of the block move L onto the arÃªte. Climb the face just to the R of the arÃªte...using the arÃªte. Totally stunning.

routes.name: Tru Grit
routes.description: Large mostly unprotected chimney.

routes.name: Teething Trouble
routes.description: Face \ arÃªte with little (or no) protection.

routes.name: Airs above Ground
routes.description: Start in open book, Traverse to left, round the corner, to top out.

routes.name: Saddle Up
routes.description: Short route to R of Airs above Ground.

routes.name: Strip Poker
routes.description: Climb the ramp 2m R of Airs above Ground. It's a short but sweet line.

routes.name: Pop Horn
routes.description: Climb the gross off width 4m R of Airs above Ground. Bit too short.

routes.name: I'll Be There
routes.description: Climb the "V" off width with the large rock jammed in it, 5.5m R of Airs above Ground

routes.name: Time Has Come
routes.description: Climb the off width open book ramp, 7m R of Airs above Ground

routes.name: Cool and Smooth
routes.description: Climb the extremely short, but very cool crack on the far R. It's actually more of a boulder problem. Worth the effort.

sectors.name: Tombstone Gulch
sectors.description: Descend as for House of Cards. Tombstone Gulch is the broken gully below House of Cards on the seaward side. The gully descends steeply towards MB. The Tombstones stand above on the seaward side.

routes.name: Dead or Alive
routes.description: Start below the blocks. Gain the large ledge. Climb the vertical crack system to the square notch. 12m

routes.name: Master of Destines
routes.description: Start on the shale ledge. Climb "V" groove onto sloped ledge. Up vertical crack L of balanced boulders, then up the "V" chimney.

routes.name: Snark
routes.description: Start on shale below vertical cracks in small buttress. Onto ledge. Up blocky off width into cubby hole chimney.

routes.name: Boojum
routes.description: Starting on shale, then up broken blocky line.
routes.first_ascent: Dave & Barbara Freer, Carl van der Lingen, Kim Blakeway & Phillip Turnbull

routes.name: Pre-Ordained
routes.description: Start on shale below crack through overhang. Through overhang, up L trending crack system. Traverse R below small roof to belay ledge.

routes.name: Pre-destined
routes.description: Start on shale below roof. Tread R into short awkward open book. Up an awkward ramp using under clings. Then up easy L trending crack system.

routes.name: The Enemies Line
routes.description: Up curving open book ramp. Easy moves to the top, then L into open book.

routes.name: Take No Prisoners
routes.description: Up twin cracks to tricky move.

routes.name: Till Death
routes.description: Climb the large off width.

routes.name: Grave Yard Shift
routes.description: Up large flaring off width.

routes.name: Cool 'n Crispy
routes.description: 6m of perfect jam crack. Unfortunately so short. This is found above the landward face of Tombstone Gulch.

routes.name: Undertaker
routes.description: Climb the nice, but to short crack on the DM side of the Tombstone.

routes.name: Coroner
routes.description: Scramble down Tombstone Gulch to below the landward arÃªte on the DM side of the Tombstone. Climb the obvious crack line then the landward face of the Tombstone.

routes.name: Mortician
routes.description: Scramble down Tombstone Gulch to below the landward arÃªte on the MB side of the Tombstone. Climb the off width onto blocky ledge. Up ramp on MB side of Tombstone.

routes.name: Pall Bearer
routes.description: Climb the very short seaward face.

routes.name: Tomb Raider
routes.description: Up the short arÃªte between Pall Bearer and Undertaker.

sectors.name: Graveyard
sectors.description: The Tombstones are easy to see. Prominent free-standing squares of rock between House of Cards and the sea. The Graveyard is below The Tombstones towards the large sea stack which is Shark Fin.

routes.name: Gecko Blaster
routes.description: Start in corner crack then up the arÃªte.

routes.name: Budgie Lungs
routes.description: Start in corner crack, then onto sloping ledge. Up the open book.

routes.name: Wet, Wet, Wet!
routes.description: Traverse L towards sea stack. Climb the off width to gain a ledge. Then climb the chimney Does not sound sweet!

routes.name: Beer Belly
routes.description: Very short easy line.

routes.name: Grunt
routes.description: Short, easy, veg climb.

routes.name: Low Gear
routes.description: In the descent gully. To L of prominent crack.

routes.name: Intoxicated
routes.description: Climb the open book. Climb between the two crags. Top out between the two rocks on top.

routes.name: Brass Monkey
routes.description: Climb the off width open book. Step R onto ramp, then up the easy crack.

routes.name: Brass Monkey Direct
routes.description: Up the off width open book. Trend L to the top out.

routes.name: Crackamania
routes.description: Behind bananas. Crack runs through roof.

routes.name: Pooh's Corner
routes.description: Open book to left of Crackamania.

routes.name: Puppet on a String
routes.description: Climb the crack located about 3 m to the left of Pooh Corner.

routes.name: Stinky Winky
routes.description: Too short to be any good.

sectors.name: Buccaneer's Cove
sectors.description: This is the wide rocky ravine between the 4th and 5TH Headlands. The best approach is an abseil from a large boulder 20m above Dead Man's Chest. Or walk around on the seaward side of Dead Man's Chest at low tide. Buccaneer's Cove is definitely a low tide area only.

routes.name: Savage Attack
routes.description: Jam up nice crack in centre of very short, inland face.

routes.name: Broken Tooth
routes.description: Start down and 1m R of Savage Attack.

routes.name: Hammerhead
routes.description: Up the obvious crack 4m R of Broken Tooth.

routes.name: Back Biter
routes.description: Climb the broken seaward arÃªte.

routes.name: Koeksister
routes.description: Climb the nice, but very small crack about 20m away, towards Strip Tease.

routes.name: Land Ahoy
routes.description: This route is on the broken sea ward face between the Dead Man's Chest and the main wall on the DM side of Buccaneers Cove. Up steps to chimney. Head for the grassy slope.

routes.name: Ghost Ship
routes.description: 2m R of Land Ahoy. Up easy steps to short, but nice open book. Head for the grass.

routes.name: Shiver-me-rocks
routes.description: 2m L of cave on the DM side, up the seriously loose broken line to the grassy slope above.

routes.name: Glas & Draad
routes.description: Prominent crack on the wall on the DM side of Buccaneers Cove. Very greasy finger crack. Eventually some gear was dogged on. Good line though.

routes.name: Dragon Slayer
routes.description: Starts just L of cave, which is situated at far R of the wall on the DM side of Buccaneers Cove. Climb the Chimney into off width. Topping out on steep grass slopes. A full bakkie of loose rock was unloaded from this line during the opening ascent.

routes.name: The-One-Eyed-Fanny-Pirate
routes.description: In the passage, about 4m from the cave on the MB side, climb the fist crack. Then move L & up.

routes.name: Wet Wild Wet
routes.description: Up a prominent R facing open book.
routes.first_ascent: Jakobus Oosthuizen & Dirk Van Der Walt

routes.name: Access Route
routes.description: Start by stepping off the block on the land ward side at low tide. Climb up a few meters then Traverse along the line where the shale meets the dolerite on the seaward side. There is a large safe platform on the seaward side from which to belay. All the routes can be reached dry by using this route.

routes.name: Barracuda
routes.description: Up the prominent crack on the land ward corner of the DM facing wall.

routes.name: Sting Ray
routes.description: Thin crack 4m R of Barracuda.

routes.name: The Mobster's Lobster
routes.description: Up the loose line on the DM corner of the seaward face.

routes.name: Sea Urchin
routes.description: The obvious line in the middle of the seaward face. Also the down climb.

headlands.name: 5th Headland
headlands.description: On the road to Double Mouth, take the second track. Follow the track that trends in the DM direction. Park on the last headland or head land closest to DM.

sectors.name: Diffusion
sectors.description: This is the line of crags along the top of the Morgan Bay side of the 5th Headland. To reach them, find the scramble, which leads to Linear Ledge, follow the grassy slope inland, to the Diffusion Wall. Eager Beaver stands above a dense thicket of strelitzias further to the R. This is the rampy rocks land ward of the walk in to Linear Ledge, 10m R of the prominent open book, Midnight Sun.

routes.name: Banana FL
routes.description: Climb the broken stepped ramp. Then R past roof.

routes.name: Broken Banana
routes.description:
Climb the easy ramp. Top out to the R.
A perfect open book on the LH side, indicates the start of Diffusion Wall.

routes.name: Midnight Sun
routes.description: This is the short, but perfect open book on the L of the crag.

routes.name: Kontiki
routes.description: 3m R of open book. Up vertical crack system then onto veg ledge. Up the small sea facing face to gain spacious belay ledge.

routes.name: Ra
routes.description: 5.5m R of open book. Up horizontal cracks for 4m, then up L curving crack to gain veg ledge. Up the small sea facing face to gain spacious belay ledge.

routes.name: Tai Ki
routes.description: 6m R of open book. Climb the of width, moving into the off width on the L. Traverse L along a ledge to gain the veg ledge. Up the small sea facing face to gain spacious belay ledge.

routes.name: Diffusion
routes.description: Start under small roofs a few metres L of the blocky steps of Fu Snag. Pass the roof on the R to reach a sharp flake. Easy moves to the top.

routes.name: Fu Sang
routes.description: Follow crack up blocky steps.

routes.name: Walk Out
routes.description: Stepped scramble.

routes.name: Vesectomy Vision
routes.description: About 6m R of Walk Out, climb the openbook hand crack. Avoid the loose rock., top out on the grass slope. There is nothing to belay from exept grass tuftsâ¦.unless you have been smart enough to park your car near to the edge.

sectors.name: Eager Beaver
sectors.description: Find your way through the strelitzias to the wall.

routes.name: Eager Beaver
routes.description: 3m R of where the base of the wall drops sharply. Climb onto a small ledge to gain a short off width. Then climb the R tending slab, which leads to a good crack up the next slab. This route is better than it looks.

routes.name: Elephants Asshole
routes.description: About 5m R of Eager Beaver is a nasty, dirty gully, which runs under a huge chock stone. Climb the gully into the cave and behind the chock stone. Wriggle through a small orifice. Do not repeat this route as there is a danger of becoming stuck in the orifice. When this happens, you will feel like an elephant sized asshole. Gavin Peckham refused to second.

sectors.name: Linear Ledge
sectors.description: On the side of the headland that faces Morgan Bay find the steep decent gully. This area is where a large majority of climbing takes place at Morgan Bay.

routes.name: Easy Livin
routes.description: Start 2m L of descent scramble. Climb stepped easy face to grassy ledge. Move L into open book. Take easiest line to the top.

routes.name: Pins and Needles
routes.description: Climb the crack line to the L of Easy Livin.

routes.name: Blue Swede Shoes
routes.description: Just R of Old Fashioned Book, up the off width, onto ledge. Move R and up.

routes.name: Old Fashioned Book
routes.description: Off width open book into chimney.

routes.name: Worm on a Hook
routes.description: 2m L of Old Fashioned Book, climb the vertical crack. Break slightly L to a ledge, then continue up crack to the top.

routes.name: Alien Away
routes.description: 4m L of Old Fashioned Book, climb a short, slightly overhanging crack line to the same ledge as on Worm on a Hook. Continue straight up awkward double crack to the top.

routes.name: Drunk In The Midnight Choir
routes.description: 1m R of Burning Bush, climb the crack using poor pinch grips. A tricky traverse 8m up, leads to another crack. Protection is sparse, but good.

routes.name: Burning Bush
routes.description: This is the grungy looking recess just R of Linear Accelerator.

routes.name: Linear Accelerator
routes.description: Climb the cracks into prominent open book ramp.

routes.name: Bannana Boy
routes.description: Start just L of Linear Accelerator. Climb face trending L. Traverse 1m R on horizontal rail, then up thin crack to ledge.

routes.name: All My Sins Remembered
routes.description: Step off inverted âVâ rock, then streight up.

routes.name: No Pain, No Strain, No Brain
routes.description: Step off inverted âVâ. Break L.

routes.name: Friendly Thief
routes.description: Open book through small roof.

routes.name: Bird On a Wire
routes.description: ArÃªte L of All My Sins Remembered.

routes.name: Teenage Punks
routes.description: Bolted by Derek Marshall. ï These bolts are old & dangerous.
routes.first_ascent: Morne van der Mescht & Derek Marshall

routes.name: Fiddler's Green
routes.description: P1 â 15 Start as for Heels of a Soft Prayer Whispered. 4m up Traverse L. Climb the RH crack system. P2 â 18 Perfect crack. Tiny R facing open book crack.

routes.name: Brave, Brave Mouse
routes.description: P1 â 17 Start 6m L of where the platform drops into the sea. Up short, steep crack to gain stepped face bearing L. Traverse the loose slat of rock (1m long). Up thin crack. Step R to avoid trouble then onto Linear Ledge. P2 â 14 Climb the obvious crack to the R of the open book. Move L at the top to avoid poor rock.

routes.name: The Razor's Edge
routes.description: Broken open book.

routes.name: Sinister Mouse
routes.description: The climb to the L of Brave, Brave Mouse 2nd pitch, on the extreme L of the Linear Ledge.

routes.name: The Peanut Line
routes.description: Short open book.

sectors.name: Sweet Surrender
sectors.description: Easiest walk-in is via Whale Bone, under Needle Wall & then past Carnival is Over. The scramble with care to the grassy terrace under Sweet Surrender. There are 2 scurry holes that lead to tricky scrambles. You can also access by abseil off your tow bar (70m rope required).

routes.name: War Doctor
routes.description: Up L facing open book, over ledge & into further open book. Over block & up R trending ramp. Belay on ledge at the start of the scurry hole.

routes.name: Forsaking Fate
routes.description: Up slab into R facing open book. Step L accrss ledge & up perfect hand crack. An easy scramble gets you down.

routes.name: Loosing the Balance
routes.description: Up ramp & into hand crack. Then directly up to belay ledge.

routes.name: Eat My Veggie
routes.description: Start in R facting open book notch, up ramp into off width & into R facing fist open book.

routes.name: The Closed Eyes of Paradise
routes.description: Start on jugs, up onto slab. Stay L of open book. Onto ledge, step R into L facing off width open book. Up grassu slope & into R facing chimney open book.

routes.name: Spare Me Your Judgment
routes.description: Up bear hug style blunt arete. Over easing ramp to belay on grassy ledge above.

routes.name: War Hammer
routes.description: Prominent crack.

routes.name: Metal Machine
routes.description: R facing, R trending open book. Through a small overhang to belay from the ledge above.

routes.name: Cliff Warfare
routes.description: Up ramp onto ledge. Then L into chimney.

routes.name: Gannet View
routes.description: Slab into chimney.

routes.name: Sinus
routes.description: Up short slab to a ledge. Up using the arete to reach the overhangs. Through the RH overhang.

routes.name: Sweet Surrender
routes.description: Slab to ledge, open book, below roof break right.
routes.first_ascent: Dave Freer & Carl van der Lingend

routes.name: Double Sensce
routes.description: Slab into stair way.

routes.name: No Cam Fit
routes.description: Up Slab, into off width open book.

routes.name: Old Man
routes.description: Easy slab, onto perfect hand crack, then face.

sectors.name: Dunkirk
sectors.description: From Sweet Surrender abseil 45m to the wave cut platform, 2m above the sea. This area can only be climbed on a calm day at very low tide. Most routes are about 40m or more and many are covered in bird shit.

routes.name: Dive Bombers
routes.description: Traverse out above the wave cut platform to a stance. Up easy ramp, steps, ledges & over easy ground to the top.

routes.name: Crack a Doey
routes.description: Traverse out above the wave cut platform to a stance. Up easy ramp, steps, ledges & up a short open book to a ledge. Step R a few metres. Up easy ground to the top.

routes.name: Goeden Morgan
routes.description: Up broken ramp & steps. Up to grassy ledge.

routes.name: The Snow Goose
routes.description: Stepped slab to ledge, up broken arÃªte to grass ledge.

routes.name: Good Morning Morgan
routes.description: Broken steps to ledge.

routes.name: Three Steps to the Left
routes.description: Up stepper rails to the L, into crack break, then easy ledges to the top.

routes.name: Evacuation
routes.description: Broken open book into chimney.

routes.name: Baby Elephant Walk
routes.description: L up ramp, into open book, up to Sweet Surrender ledge.

routes.name: Stuka
routes.description: Medium hand crack.

routes.name: His Eyes are Bigger Than His Balls
routes.description: Up ledges, into open book, onto face to the top.

routes.name: Just Up Allen's Alley
routes.description: Hand crack into V shaped chimney, finish up chimney to L.

routes.name: Steel Tormentor
routes.description: Off width into perfect finger crack.

routes.name: Spitfire
routes.description: Start on platform, broken open book onto lower ramp.

routes.name: Wafens SS
routes.description: Climb the awkward off width open book 2,5m R of Train Hardâ¦Fight Easy! Find the easiest way to the top across steps and ledges.

routes.name: Train Hardâ¦Fight Easy!
routes.description: Up short, but good chimney. Find the easiest way to the top across steps and ledges.

routes.name: Desolation Angel
routes.description: Up seemingly short open book. Then up arÃªte directly above. Pass roof to the L.

routes.name: All Fired Up
routes.description: Up awful steps to L most open book, which is on the R. Up to L of small roof.

routes.name: Dunkirkâs Toilet
routes.description: Up awful steps into awful gully. Traverse R just before the grass.

routes.name: Rudely-Hewn Grandeur
routes.description: Start 7m R of huge dark chimney. Climb the serrated open book. Move L onto large ledge. Up very nasty unprotected chimney to top of the pillar. Continue up ramps to top out.

routes.name: Ticklish Cauliflower
routes.description: Start 2m R of huge dark chimney. Climb the absolutely perfect hand crack to the big ledge. Move R across ledge to climb the very nasty unprotected chimney to top of the pillar. Continue up ramps to top out.

sectors.name: Carnival is Over
sectors.description: This sector is identified by the large boulder which forms a 'bridge' between the grassy cliff top and the top of the free-standing pillar known as Carnival is Over. The bridge creates 'The Eye'. The easiest & safest walk in is to the DM side of CiO Pillar then follow the path below Whale Bone in the direction of DM. Descend on easy ground to below Needle Wall.

routes.name: Teddy Bear
routes.description: This is the line on the DM side of the Flycatcher slab.

routes.name: Flycatcher
routes.description: This is the awesome looking slab on the DM side of the Pillar.

routes.name: Lekker â Lekker!
routes.description: Start under the arch formed by the Fly Catcher slabs leaning against the main pillar. Climb past a giant chock stone, then L under the arch to gain a loverly lay back.

routes.name: The Carnival is Over
routes.description: Start by climbing the vertical crack in the middle of the seaward face. Trend R to gain the awesome hand crack which widens into an off width.

routes.name: Watching the Ocean
routes.description: Start at the R of the huge flake at the base of seaward face. Climb the thin crack to below a large protruding block. Move L of it and onto small ledge above. Climb the arete, finishing through the âVâ-notch.

routes.name: Yellow Jester
routes.description: Climb the MB side of CiO pillar.

routes.name: Power Finger
routes.description: This route climbs the Carnival is Over Pillar on the MB side of the large block which forms The Bridge. This is the sea facing wall on the landward side, below The Eye.

routes.name: Ãlan Audacity
routes.description: Up crack, step R onto ledge. Up steps into base of open book. Step down & R into layaway formed by huge flake.

routes.name: "S" Bend
routes.description: This is the zig-zag crack system 2nd to the L of the Full Value arete.

routes.name: Breaking the Law
routes.description: First crack to L of the Full Value arete.
routes.first_ascent: Mike Cartright, Kevin Smith & Stuart Middlemiss

routes.name: Full Value
routes.description: Cracks just R of arÃªte, using arÃªte. Face round the corner to the R.

routes.name: One White Duck on Your Wall = 0Âº = Nothing at All
routes.description: Strange, slightly over hanging, break R of top over hangs.

routes.name: Haze on the Sky Line
routes.description: Start up perfect open book, then up prominent crack system.

routes.name: Rise To The Sky
routes.description: Up the âVâ groove, rail R onto a ledge, then up to the R to gain the top of the block. Step R to a good belay.

routes.name: Inside Joke
routes.description: R facing open book behind boulders.

routes.name: Ma
routes.description: L facing open book behind boulders.

routes.name: Pa
routes.description: âVâ groove.

sectors.name: Strandlooper Buttress
sectors.description: This buttress is below Carnival is Over in the seaward direction. Abseil from the large boulders about 10m from Carnival is Over or look for the scramble down on the DM side of the buttress. Routes are recorded from MB to DM.

routes.name: Swem Jannie! Swem!
routes.description: Climb the obvious chimney. This is a really cool chimney. Totally recommended. Especially if you enjoy dark, damp, slippery and awkward routes. Take a 5 & 6 Friend as well as two No.4 Big Bro. The belayer should ideally have some diving experience. Derek was half way up when a freak big wave came in. Water splashed into the chimney. Belayer was washed off his feet.

routes.name: Muscle Cracker
routes.description: Start in small open book, up obvious crack.

routes.name: Storm Walker
routes.description: Up steps to awkward chimney. Climb the off width.

routes.name: Vuga Vuga
routes.description: Up loose, groove to top.

sectors.name: Needle Wall
sectors.description: Easiest access is to find a break on the MB side of Whale Bone. Follow the path at the base of Whale Bone towards the DM side. Descend about 15m. Needle Wall runs for about 40m almost to CiO.

routes.name: Chicken Noodle Do
routes.description: Easy short line on DM face.

routes.name: No Chicken Noodles
routes.description: Easy short line on DM face.

routes.name: Mine! Mine! Mine!
routes.description: Climb the arÃªte.

routes.name: Rain Drops
routes.description: Left of cammed boulder.

routes.name: Stone Age Cam
routes.description: Right of cammed boulder.

routes.name: Heros of Bangui
routes.description: 16m; Short off width open book.

routes.name: Mine Kamf
routes.description: Short off Width.

routes.name: Lucky Pet
routes.description: Past veg, up twin cracks.

routes.name: Lucky
routes.description: Chimney.

routes.name: Fallen in War
routes.description: 22m; Up slab onto ledge. Stay on slab L of L facing open book. Then rail L up short off width section to ledge.

routes.name: The Cast Pit
routes.description: Up shallow recess, onto ledge into left into open book, top out.

routes.name: Alexcor
routes.description: Start in LH dirty recess, joining Mine Shaft towards top. Stay outside the âmine shaftâ chimney.

routes.name: Mine Shaft
routes.description: Start in dirty RH resess. Up most prominent line. Stay outside the âmine shaftâ chimney.

routes.name: Birth Canal
routes.description: Start in dirty RH resess which is Mine Shaft. Near the top go into the Mine Shaft chimney. Exit on the landward side of the chimney through a scurry hole.

routes.name: Good to Go
routes.description: Up blocks, steps & most prominent open book.

routes.name: Hair of My Chiny, Chin, Chin
routes.description: Up ledges and blocks to the top.

routes.name: Like a Schnaffeling Snake
routes.description: Up blocky steps onto slabs, step L into open book.

routes.name: Follow On
routes.description: Short off width.

routes.name: Step by Step
routes.description: Easy chimney.

routes.name: Bring Me to Life
routes.description: 16m; Up the LH arÃªte. Start is hard. Gear is very marginal. Near the top, break out L into thin crack.

routes.name: Chosen Not Forsaken
routes.description: Start up on unlikely jug that looks like it will peal off. Into small open book roof. Move slightly L onto arÃªte, then back R & directly up. Rail a bit R, then back L onto the line.
routes.first_ascent: Derek Marshall, Ruben Snyman & Tyson Baars

routes.name: The Needle and the Damage Done
routes.description: Open book, right through the roof, left up thin crack.

routes.name: Better Than Sex
routes.description: Start a few meters R of The Needle and the Damage Done. Directly below the RH end of the rarrow roof at the top of the face.

routes.name: Sex
routes.description: Climb the arete.

routes.name: In Trance
routes.description: Start in open book.

routes.name: Stitch by Stitch
routes.description: Large chimney.

routes.name: Old Age
routes.description: Easy short off width chimney.

sectors.name: Made to Fit
sectors.description: This sector runs discontinuously between Lower Slippery When Wet and Pivotal Motion. There is potential for a few more hard bolted routes.

routes.name: Made to Fit
routes.description: Climb blocky open book steps on land ward side.

routes.name: PROJECT
routes.description:
Derek Marshall (8B&C)
ï Bolted in about 2003. These bolts are old & dangerous.

routes.name: PROJECT
routes.description:
Derek Marshall (C only)
To the R of (2). Only top chains at this stage.
ï Bolted in about 2003. These bolts are old & dangerous.

routes.name: Fit as a Fiddle
routes.description: Easy crack L of open book.

routes.name: Fit as a Porksta
routes.description: Big open book.

routes.name: Porksta Endurance
routes.description: Fist crack open book, into off width.

routes.name: Exact a Mondo
routes.description: Diagonal crack system through easy ramp.

routes.name: Better Days
routes.description: This route is away to the R of the rest. Climb the fat undercut off width crack. Will need 6 Friend to protect. Short, but sweet!

routes.name: One Alone
routes.description: Situated on its own to the R of Better Days. Climb the RH arete.

sectors.name: Pivotal Motion
sectors.description: Although this area is short it has some potential for harder bolted routes.

routes.name: Pivotal Motion
routes.description: On MB side. Start R of arete. Move L onto arete. Then onto ledge.

routes.name: Triumph of Steel
routes.description: Derek Marshall & Allen Luck May 2003 (5B&C). Bolted in about 2003. These bolts are old & dangerous.

routes.name: The Gladiator
routes.description: Awkward off width through roof.

routes.name: Anti Terror
routes.description: Open book to top of pinnical.

routes.name: Noodle Attack
routes.description: Prominent broken crack to L of open book.

sectors.name: Booze Cruise
sectors.description: This is the small sector directly above Just a Breeze.

routes.name: Booze Control
routes.description: Start L of twin cracks. Top out in LH crack.

routes.name: Booze Cruise
routes.description: There are two obvious parallel crack lines towards the left-hand end of this crag. Booze Cruise takes the LH crack line.

routes.name: Trad Intoxicated
routes.description: Smooth perfect chimney. L of large hanging chock stone.

sectors.name: Just a Breeze
sectors.description: This is a short section of rock to the R of Smooth Operator. See topo for route locations.

routes.name: Just a Breeze
routes.description: Climb chimney to ledge. Then 2nd chimney to top of block.

routes.name: Angst
routes.description: Seaward blunt arÃªte. This is a hi-ball route with no gear (zero). Marshall, having more to live for, refused to follow.

routes.name: Small Fry
routes.description: Start in easy crack. Top out on large boulder, then jump from the top.

sectors.name: Smooth Operator
sectors.description: This is the last small piece of rock as the 5th Headland curves down towards DM. The routes were scrambled without ropes, but have fairly good grass landings.

routes.name: Forked Tongue
routes.description: Climb the crack with the large wedged block on the DM side. Go L or R where crack splits.

routes.name: Smooth Operator
routes.description: Climb the seaward face starting on the rock shelf, past two pockets to the top. There is no gear what so ever.

sectors.name: Outlaw Crag
sectors.description: Driving towards DM, just after the dairy (square building to the R), pass through a gate. Outlaw Crag is in the river valley to the R. (Private property â contact landowner before climbing.)

routes.name: Forgive Us Our Trespassing
routes.description: Up stepped blocks on the river side of free stander, to top of pinnacle.

routes.name: Lucky Luke
routes.description: Up easy cracks to big ledge. Up crack. Traverse R to huge flake. Top out.

sectors.name: Black Rock
sectors.description: From the Double Mouth campsite, walk along the beach in the direction of East London. Cross the river at low tide and continue to the dolerite outcrops on the far side. The crags are short and suitable for bouldering or easy routes.

routes.name: Cling to the Dream
routes.description: Easy line on the far L.

routes.name: Smart as Can Be
routes.description: Easy steps breaking L.

routes.name: Silent Symptoms
routes.description: Inner chimney. Through hole in the roof.

routes.name: Leopards & Lilies
routes.description: Outer chimney.

routes.name: Seal Struck
routes.description: Smooth chimney to the R of the prominent chimney.
